verses.verse: Let me sing <S%H7891><s%> for my wellbeloved <S%H3039><s%> a song <S%H7892><s%> of my beloved <S%H3039><s%> touching his vineyard <S%H3754><s%>. My wellbeloved <S%H3039><s%> had a vineyard <S%H3754><s%> in a very fruitful <S%H1121><s%> hill <S%H7161><s%>:

and he digged <S%H5823><s%> it <S%H5619><s%>, and gathered out the stones thereof <S%H5193><s%>, and planted it with the choicest vine <S%H8321><s%>, and built <S%H1129><s%> a tower <S%H4026><s%> in the midst <S%H8432><s%> of it <S%H2672><s%>, and also hewed out a winepress <S%H3342><s%> therein <S%H6960><s%>: and he looked that it should bring forth <S%H6213><s%> grapes <S%H6025><s%>, and it brought forth <S%H6213><s%> wild grapes <S%H891><s%>.
And now <S%H3427><s%>, O inhabitants of Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%> and men <S%H376><s%> of Judah <S%H3063><s%>, judge <S%H8199><s%>, I pray you <S%H3754><s%>, betwixt me and my vineyard.

What could have been done <S%H6213><s%> more to my vineyard <S%H3754><s%>, that I have not done <S%H6213><s%> in it <S%H4069><s%>? wherefore, when I looked <S%H6960><s%> that it should bring forth <S%H6213><s%> grapes <S%H6025><s%>, brought it forth <S%H6213><s%> wild grapes <S%H891><s%>?

And now I will tell <S%H3045><s%> you what I will do <S%H6213><s%> to my vineyard <S%H3754><s%>: I will take away <S%H5493><s%> the hedge <S%H4881><s%> thereof <S%H1197><s%>, and it shall be eaten up; I will break down <S%H6555><s%> the wall <S%H1447><s%> thereof <S%H4823><s%>, and it shall be trodden down:

and I will lay <S%H7896><s%> it waste <S%H1326><s%>; it shall not be pruned <S%H2168><s%> nor hoed <S%H5737><s%>; but there shall come up <S%H5927><s%> briers <S%H8068><s%> and thorns <S%H7898><s%>: I will also command <S%H6680><s%> the clouds <S%H5645><s%> that they rain <S%H4305><s%> no rain upon it <S%H4306><s%>.

For the vineyard <S%H3754><s%> of Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> of hosts <S%H6635><s%> is the house <S%H1004><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%>, and the men <S%H376><s%> of Judah <S%H3063><s%> his pleasant <S%H8191><s%> plant <S%H5194><s%>: and he looked <S%H6960><s%> for justice <S%H4941><s%>, but <S%H4939><s%>, behold, oppression; for righteousness <S%H6666><s%>, but <S%H6818><s%>, behold, a cry.

Woe <S%H1945><s%> unto them that join <S%H5060><s%> house <S%H1004><s%> to house <S%H1004><s%>, that lay <S%H7126><s%> field <S%H7704><s%> to field <S%H7704><s%>, till there be no <S%H657><s%> room <S%H4725><s%>, and ye be made to dwell <S%H3427><s%> alone in the midst <S%H7130><s%> of the land <S%H776><s%>!

In mine ears <S%H241><s%> saith Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> of hosts <S%H6635><s%>, Of a truth <S%H3808><s%> many <S%H7227><s%> houses <S%H1004><s%> shall be desolate <S%H8047><s%>, even great <S%H1419><s%> and fair <S%H2896><s%>, without inhabitant <S%H3427><s%>.

For <S%H3588><s%> ten <S%H6235><s%> acres <S%H6776><s%> of vineyard <S%H3754><s%> shall yield <S%H6213><s%> one <S%H259><s%> bath <S%H1324><s%>, and a homer <S%H2563><s%> of seed <S%H2233><s%> shall yield <S%H6213><s%> but an ephah <S%H374><s%>.

Woe <S%H1945><s%> unto them that rise up early <S%H7925><s%> in the morning <S%H1242><s%>, that they may follow <S%H7291><s%> strong drink <S%H7941><s%>; that tarry <S%H309><s%> late into the night <S%H5399><s%>, till wine <S%H3196><s%> inflame them <S%H1814><s%>!

And the harp <S%H3658><s%> and the lute <S%H5035><s%>, the tabret <S%H8596><s%> and the pipe <S%H2485><s%>, and wine <S%H3196><s%>, are in their feasts <S%H4960><s%>; but they regard <S%H5027><s%> not the work <S%H6467><s%> of Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>, neither have they considered <S%H7200><s%> the operation <S%H4639><s%> of his hands <S%H3027><s%>.

Therefore my people <S%H5971><s%> are gone into captivity <S%H1540><s%> for lack of knowledge <S%H1847><s%>; and their honorable <S%H3519><s%> men <S%H4962><s%> are famished <S%H7458><s%>, and their multitude <S%H1995><s%> are parched <S%H6704><s%> with thirst <S%H6772><s%>.

Therefore Sheol <S%H7585><s%> hath enlarged <S%H7337><s%> its desire <S%H6310><s%>, and opened <S%H6473><s%> its mouth <S%H6310><s%> without measure <S%H2706><s%>; and their glory <S%H1926><s%>, and their multitude <S%H1995><s%>, and their pomp <S%H7588><s%>, and he that rejoiceth <S%H5938><s%> among them <S%H3381><s%>, descend into it.
And the mean man <S%H120><s%> is bowed down <S%H7817><s%>, and the great man <S%H376><s%> is humbled <S%H8213><s%>, and the eyes <S%H5869><s%> of the lofty <S%H1364><s%> are humbled <S%H8213><s%>:

but Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> of hosts <S%H6635><s%> is exalted <S%H1361><s%> in justice <S%H4941><s%>, and God <S%H410><s%> the Holy <S%H6918><s%> One is sanctified <S%H6942><s%> in righteousness <S%H6666><s%>.

Then shall the lambs <S%H3532><s%> feed <S%H7462><s%> as in their pasture <S%H1699><s%>, and the waste places <S%H2723><s%> of the fat ones <S%H4220><s%> shall wanderers <S%H1481><s%> eat <S%H398><s%>.

Woe <S%H1945><s%> unto them that draw <S%H4900><s%> iniquity <S%H5771><s%> with cords <S%H2256><s%> of falsehood <S%H7723><s%>, and sin <S%H2403><s%> as it were with a cart <S%H5699><s%> rope <S%H5688><s%>;

that say <S%H559><s%>, Let him make speed <S%H4116><s%>, let him hasten <S%H2363><s%> his work <S%H4639><s%>, that we may see <S%H7200><s%> it <S%H6098><s%>; and let the counsel of the Holy One <S%H6918><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> draw nigh <S%H7126><s%> and come <S%H935><s%>, that we may know it <S%H3045><s%>!

Woe <S%H1945><s%> unto them that call <S%H559><s%> evil <S%H7451><s%> good <S%H2896><s%>, and good <S%H2896><s%> evil <S%H7451><s%>; that put <S%H7760><s%> darkness <S%H2822><s%> for light <S%H216><s%>, and light <S%H216><s%> for darkness <S%H2822><s%>; that put <S%H7760><s%> bitter <S%H4751><s%> for sweet <S%H4966><s%>, and sweet <S%H4966><s%> for bitter <S%H4751><s%>!
Woe <S%H1945><s%> unto them that are wise <S%H2450><s%> in their own eyes <S%H5869><s%>, and prudent <S%H995><s%> in their own sight <S%H6440><s%>!
Woe <S%H1945><s%> unto them that are mighty <S%H1368><s%> to drink <S%H8354><s%> wine <S%H3196><s%>, and men <S%H582><s%> of strength <S%H2428><s%> to mingle <S%H4537><s%> strong drink <S%H7941><s%>;
that justify <S%H6663><s%> the wicked <S%H7563><s%> for <S%H6118><s%> a bribe <S%H7810><s%>, and take away <S%H5493><s%> the righteousness <S%H6666><s%> of the righteous from him <S%H6662><s%>!

Therefore as the tongue of fire <S%H784><s%> devoureth <S%H398><s%> the stubble <S%H7179><s%>, and as the dry grass <S%H2842><s%> sinketh down <S%H7503><s%> in the flame <S%H3956><s%>, so their root <S%H8328><s%> shall be as rottenness <S%H4716><s%>, and their blossom <S%H6525><s%> shall go up <S%H5927><s%> as dust <S%H80><s%>; because they have rejected <S%H3988><s%> the law <S%H8451><s%> of Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> of hosts <S%H6635><s%>, and despised <S%H5006><s%> the word <S%H565><s%> of the Holy One <S%H6918><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%>.

Therefore is the anger <S%H639><s%> of Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> kindled <S%H2734><s%> against his people <S%H5971><s%>, and he hath stretched forth <S%H5186><s%> his hand <S%H3027><s%> against them <S%H5221><s%>, and hath smitten them <S%H2022><s%>; and the mountains tremble <S%H7264><s%>, and their dead bodies <S%H5038><s%> are as refuse <S%H5478><s%> in the midst <S%H7130><s%> of the streets <S%H2351><s%>. For all this his anger <S%H639><s%> is not turned away <S%H7725><s%>, but his hand <S%H3027><s%> is stretched out still <S%H5186><s%>.

And he will lift up <S%H5375><s%> an ensign <S%H5251><s%> to the nations <S%H1471><s%> from far <S%H7350><s%>, and will hiss <S%H8319><s%> for them from the end <S%H7097><s%> of the earth <S%H776><s%>; and <S%H935><s%>, behold, they shall come with speed <S%H4120><s%> swiftly <S%H7031><s%>.

None shall be weary <S%H5889><s%> nor stumble <S%H3782><s%> among them <S%H5123><s%>; none shall slumber nor sleep <S%H3462><s%>; neither shall the girdle <S%H232><s%> of their loins <S%H2504><s%> be loosed <S%H6605><s%>, nor the latchet <S%H8288><s%> of their shoes <S%H5275><s%> be broken <S%H5423><s%>:

whose arrows <S%H2671><s%> are sharp <S%H8150><s%>, and all their bows <S%H7198><s%> bent <S%H1869><s%>; their horses <S%H5483><s%>' hoofs <S%H6541><s%> shall be accounted <S%H2803><s%> as flint <S%H6862><s%>, and their wheels <S%H1534><s%> as a whirlwind <S%H5492><s%>:

their roaring <S%H7581><s%> shall be like a lioness <S%H3833><s%>, they shall roar <S%H7580><s%> like young lions <S%H3715><s%>; yea <S%H5098><s%>, they shall roar, and lay hold <S%H270><s%> of the prey <S%H2964><s%>, and carry it away safe <S%H6403><s%>, and there shall be none to deliver <S%H5337><s%>.

And they shall roar <S%H5098><s%> against them in that day <S%H3117><s%> like the roaring <S%H5100><s%> of the sea <S%H3220><s%>: and if one look <S%H5027><s%> unto the land <S%H776><s%>, behold <S%H2822><s%>, darkness and distress <S%H6862><s%>; and the light <S%H216><s%> is darkened <S%H2821><s%> in the clouds thereof <S%H6183><s%>.
